tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensitive_data (id INT, data VARCHAR(255), sensitivity_level VARCHAR(50))
CREATE TABLE encryption_policies (policy_id INT, policy_name VARCHAR(100), description TEXT)

CREATE TABLE data_access (
    user_id INT,
    data_id INT,
    access_time TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (data_id) REFERENCES sensitive_data(id)
);

CREATE TABLE sensitive_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  data VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  encryption_key VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE access_policies (
  policy_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT NOT NULL,
  data_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  access_level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE encryption_keys (
  key_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  key_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  key_value VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE access_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT NOT NULL,
  accessed_data VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  access_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)
